title: Mr. Money Mustache
author: Pete Adeney (Mr. Money Mustache)
description: The blog that launched a thousand early retirees. Pete retired at 30 and writes about frugality, investing, and living a rich life on less. Essential reading for any FIRE seeker.

title: ChooseFI
author: Brad Barrett & Jonathan Mendonsa
description: Community-driven FIRE content with actionable strategies, podcast episodes, and local groups. One of the largest FIRE communities on the internet.

title: JL Collins Stock Series
author: JL Collins
description: The definitive guide to index fund investing for FIRE. Collins explains why simple investing beats complex strategies, and why the stock market is your friend.

title: Bogleheads Wiki
author: Bogleheads Community
description: The gold standard reference for passive investing philosophy inspired by Vanguard founder John Bogle. Covers everything from asset allocation to tax optimization.

title: Mad Fientist
author: Brandon (Mad Fientist)
description: Deep dives into tax optimization, account strategy, and the psychological side of FIRE. Brandon is known for advanced strategies like Roth conversion ladders and IRA hacking.

title: Early Retirement Now
author: Karsten Jeske (Big ERN)
description: The most rigorous analytical take on the 4% rule and safe withdrawal rates. Big ERN's SWR series is required reading for anyone serious about retirement planning.

title: Afford Anything
author: Paula Pant
description: Paula's philosophy: you can afford anything, but not everything. Covers FIRE, real estate, entrepreneurship, and making intentional choices about money and life.

title: Financial Samurai
author: Sam Dogen
description: Sam retired at 34 from Goldman Sachs. He covers fat FIRE, real estate investing, negotiating severance, and living well in expensive cities.

title: Our Next Life
author: Tanja Hester & Mark Bunge
description: Tanja and Mark documented their journey to early retirement and wrote the book Work Optional. Excellent perspective on life after FIRE and the emotional side of the journey.

title: ChooseFI Podcast
author: Brad Barrett & Jonathan Mendonsa
description: 500+ episodes covering all aspects of FIRE with expert guests. Consistently rated one of the top personal finance podcasts. Perfect for commutes and workouts.

title: Mad Fientist Podcast
author: Brandon (Mad Fientist)
description: In-depth interviews with FIRE thought leaders, early retirees, and financial experts. Smaller episode count but every episode is high quality.

title: Afford Anything Podcast
author: Paula Pant
description: Conversations about money, real estate, life philosophy, and the intersection of FIRE with purpose. Paula asks deep questions and challenges conventional wisdom.

title: The Simple Path to Wealth
author: JL Collins
description: The definitive FIRE investing book. Collins distills decades of investing wisdom into a simple, actionable strategy centered on low-cost index funds. A must-read.

title: Your Money or Your Life
author: Vicki Robin & Joe Dominguez
description: The book that started the FIRE movement before it had a name. Reframes money as life energy and provides a 9-step program to financial independence. Life-changing.

title: Work Optional
author: Tanja Hester
description: A practical and emotional guide to retiring early or semi-retiring. Covers the financial and psychological aspects of leaving traditional employment.

title: The Millionaire Next Door
author: Thomas J. Stanley & William D. Danko
description: Research-based study of how real millionaires accumulate wealth — through frugality and discipline, not flashy spending. Foundational reading for the FIRE mindset.

title: FIRECalc
author: FIRECalc Team
description: The original FIRE retirement calculator using historical market data. Tests your retirement plan against every 30-year period in history. Free and incredibly powerful.

title: cFIREsim
author: Bo (cFIREsim)
description: Monte Carlo and historical simulation calculator for retirement. More customizable than FIRECalc with support for various spending strategies and portfolio types.

title: Empower (Personal Capital)
author: Empower
description: Free financial dashboard to track net worth, investments, and retirement projections. The fee analyzer is invaluable for identifying investment cost drag.

title: r/financialindependence
author: Reddit Community
description: The largest FIRE community on Reddit with 2M+ members. Share your progress, ask questions, and learn from others on the path to financial independence.

title: r/leanfire
author: Reddit Community
description: Dedicated community for lean FIRE practitioners — those pursuing financial independence on a modest budget (typically under $40K/year). Practical and grounded advice.

title: Retirement Savings: Choosing a Withdrawal Rate That Is Sustainable (Trinity Study)
author: Cooley, Hubbard & Walz
description: The foundational 1998 academic research paper that gave us the 4% rule. Essential reading to understand the evidence behind safe withdrawal rates.

title: Safe Withdrawal Rate Series
author: Karsten Jeske (Big ERN)
description: The most comprehensive analysis of safe withdrawal rates ever published — 50+ parts covering sequence-of-returns risk, CAPE ratios, glidepaths, and more.

title: Determining Withdrawal Rates Using Historical Data
author: William Bengen
description: William Bengen's original 1994 paper introducing the 4% safe withdrawal rate based on historical data. The paper that changed retirement planning forever.

title: Playing with FIRE (Documentary)
author: Scott Rieckens
description: Documentary film following Scott Rieckens and his family as they discover the FIRE movement and change their lives. Available for streaming. Inspirational for beginners.

title: FIRE Movement Guide
author: Investopedia
description: Comprehensive overview of the FIRE movement with definitions, strategies, and pros/cons. Good starting point for complete beginners exploring FIRE for the first time.
